wikipedia_page.main: Emma Moss Booth-Tucker (8 January 1860 – 28 October 1903) known as 'The Consul', was the fourth child and second daughter of William Booth,  the founder of the Salvation Army.

response: * Emma Booth-Tucker (1860–1903), Salvation Army officer, 4th child of William and Catherine Booth
* 8 January – Emma Booth-Tucker, Salvationist (died 1903 in the United States)
* Died: Emma Booth-Tucker (born Emma Moss Booth), Salvation Army officer, daughter of William Booth, railway accident in Missouri (b. 1860)
